cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles SW of Tampa Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across the east-central Gulf toward the Florida Big Bend, then moving quickly across northern/central Florida and off the Southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near or just north of Cedar Key)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass to Englewood, FL (includes Tampa Bay region)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from the Yucatan Channel north-eastward to the Big Bend, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Monday afternoon-night with 15 % cumulative chance of sustained 34-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with localized amounts up to 8 inches Monday into early Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday afternoon and evening.
